Little Bird’s Scarf

I hate my job but cannot give it up. In part because I can’t face telling my parents that I quit another one but ultimately because of Sasha; her relentless grip on me.

I only get to see her once a month, at the regular sales and marketing meeting, and I make sure to always dress well on the day. But this morning I just couldn’t get it right, the mirror kept on sending me back to my closet as I tried on pants, changed into a simple shift dress and back into pants. When I wrapped a scarlet scarf around my throat the mirror finally seemed satisfied. I grabbed my bag and ran out the door.

Sasha dominates the room when she walks in; her strong shoulders and confident posture exude control. She has a scar on her wrist where an errant javelin embedded itself into her skin in college. By comparison I’m small and fragile. Once she’s seated she looks over to where I’ve been waiting patiently. It takes a moment but then she smiles.

I pay scant attention to the morning’s agenda and barely scribble any notes, instead drawing unfocussed doodles on the page in front of me. When Sasha speaks, my eyes follow the movement of her hands.

Finally the lunch break arrives. As the rest of our colleagues file out of the room, Sasha remains seated and I do the same. Once we are alone she puts down her pen and turns to face me: “Come with me.”

She always stays at the same hotel across the way from the office park and I need no further instructions. I wait for her to get up and walk out of the room before following her, keeping exactly ten paces behind her.

She does not bother nodding either at the security guard in the office lobby or at the hotel receptionist. I catch up to her where she’s waiting for the elevator.

I remember the second time that I rode with her in the same elevator up to her room. I had the temerity to speak: “So is there anyone else at the company who you do this with?”

My question earned me a stinging slap which sent me reeling. I dropped to the floor and mumbled, “Sorry,” to which she replied, “Not ‘sorry’ — say ‘thank you’.”

I did as I was told and today I know to remain silent.

Once the door to her room shuts behind me Sasha speaks sweetly: “Hello little bird.” She calls me ‘little bird’ in reference to my name, Robin.

“Hello, Sasha.”

She walks around me and inspects my outfit. Her hand reaches for the scarf around my throat, “What is this?”

“I got it from my sister, a birthday gift.”

Sasha smirks, “And does your sister know what you do with her pretty gift?” Her question is rhetorical.

She slides her hand in under the scarf and closes her fist around it. The cloth digs into my skin. In that moment it strikes me that she’s holding me like you would hold the collar of a disobedient dog. She pulls down hard on the scarf and my knees instinctively buckle. I settle onto the carpet, kneeling directly in front of her.

“Well I have a gift for you as well,” she continues. Her words are perfectly calculated. “Do you want to know what your gift is?”

I nod and she responds by twisting the scarf, causing it to constrict my airway.

She pulls my face towards her crotch and continues, “As a gift to you I will let you try to make me come.” With this permission my hands instantly move to her thighs and I start pushing her skirt up.

“That’s right little bird, better hurry before your air runs out.” Another twist of the scarf causes a vein in my temple to bulge as I struggle to draw air into my lungs.

“Yes. That’s good, little bird, get started quickly.”

As I frantically lick and bite at her I don’t notice that what are supposed to be demure whimpers emanating from my throat are in fact sobbing laments. In a desperate involuntary reaction I strike at her thighs and try to pull my face away from her but she simply tightens her grip.

And then, just as I feel the life drain from my face, she lets go and I drop to the floor, choking and crying.

She lets me lie on the floor, panting desperately, for a few seconds and then reaches down and wraps her hand around the scarf again.

“Come on little bird,” sarcasm drips from her words, “this is not the time to stop, I’m nowhere near orgasm yet. You still have work to do.”

Again the hand twists the scarf, again my airway protests, and again she pulls me onto my knees and my face into her. I focus on pulling as much air as possible into my lungs before the twisting scarf robs me of all further hope. Again I lick and suck at her clit and bury my tongue in her vagina and Sasha rewards my renewed focus with words of encouragement. Again I keep working until my head throbs with desperation. And again, just as I’m about to faint, she drops me to the floor.

The procedure repeats itself four times. Each time Sasha drops me to the floor she gives me just enough time to regain some control of my breathing before yanking me back up to her. And each time I become more desperate to satisfy her.

Finally, as I’m about to faint for the fourth time, I hear her cry out. The sound is distant to my suffocating mind but it is my only lifeline. Her pelvis spasms against my mouth and her hand twists the scarf one last time. My body goes limp and I drop into darkness.

When I awake the room is silent and empty. I’m lying on my back on the carpet. My lips and face are wet and sticky, my throat trembles with pain. And then the tears come and relief floods my body.

Before I go back to the meeting I untie the ruined scarf and wash and dry my face in the bathroom. I carefully close the hotel room door so as to not let the click disturb the sacred silence within.
